column4: I installed the rt2500 wireless module and I'm trying to get it to autoload at boot time, does anyone know how to do this?
finally , someone with a ralink card
i had to struggle a lot to get it working, now it works great!
cool, mine is working like a charm as well :)
i just have a script to up it, turned off network connections on bootup
okay, i'm still rather new to ubuntu/debian, how does one edit the services started on boot?
the newer ones from cvs have gotten better and better ..just feels great!
okay...many ways to do this, you want to connect your wireless on startup right?
services are started/stopped from /etc/init.d, but this is not your problem!
have u seen the howto on the wiki?
so, wep etc etc working fine?
don't have wep setup at the moment, so I don't know, but its working perfectly unenc.
holler if you need help with wep!
